website_summaries.verdict: Consumers who want a model that conceals the hose and blends in with outdoor furniture may find this model appealing, but it's also less dependable and not as strong.
pros: Stands out for its attractive design that looks more like furniture than a garden tool
A crank-free reel that holds up to 125 feet of hose and operates with water pressure
cons: While users love its innovative retraction when it works, there are numerous reports of slow retraction and even complete malfunction
The reel's plastic parts are prone to warping

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product and company
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product ever. Mine broke after 1 year and the suncast warranty process is ridiculous. They sent me a replacement part which was extremely difficult to replace and once I replaced it, it still did not work. I called back and now they want a video showing that the hose still does not work. They also sent me the wrong part the second time. My hose reel is still broken and unless I keep sending videos and pics they will not help me. Waste of time and the product is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hynes

customer_reviews.title: Gears fail!
customer_reviews.text: Internal gears failed! Cant extract the hose at all. Completely locked up with these poor quality plastic gears. Plus the small hose included with your purchase will rot and need replacing within a months time.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item put a 100 foot hose in it and after a couple months and only 4 uses, the plastic reel inside it was so warped that I couldn't even pull my hose out of it and Suncast will not help you with this at all, Amazon was nice enough to take it back and even paid me for my hose that wouldn't come out.....my advice is don't waste your money on this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Internal reel warped.  Junk.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months, the internal reel warped so badly that it it very difficult to pull out because it rubs on the inside of the case. Too late to return it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Kristin Lowry

customer_reviews.title: Back Saving Blessing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works! I am disabled with back problems and I always had to leave my garden house out for someone else to manually wind up. I saw an advertisement for one of these & decided to give it a try. Man, am I glad I did! All I ha e to do is flip a switch, which is very easy to do, and the Aquawinder takes care of the rest! The plastic hose stopper did not fit on my garden hose, so I just left it off. I stand next to the Aquawinder to turn the water off anyway, so I just stop the hose before it gets sucked in. No problem. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Emler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hose Reel
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Aquawinder hose reel. I have not had to replace the older ones, this is an addition. Set up is easy and the convenience of the auto reeling is great. I have several very long garden hoses and his really makes it easy to store them. It is water powered which means that the water must be on while retracting and the water is discharged through a small hose on the side. Rather than just discharge the water onto the pavement, I capture it in a watering can and use the water for potted plants. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I've had this for a couple of months now and it's working just fine. The only issue I had was that I couldn't use the little stopper thing. My hose is 5/8 in thick and although it says it can accommodate that size it didn't. Not a big deal though. I did take 1 star off because of that.
customer_reviews.author: eliebellie

customer_reviews.title: One person cannot pull hard enough to remove the hose
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easy to roll hose up but is horrible for removing hose. The hose binds when you try to pull it out and you have to open the top and turn by hand repeatedly to remove the hose. The supplied stakes are not sufficient because you have to pull so hard to remove the hose. Will not buy again. I've had it for a while now and it takes 2 people to get the hose out, one has to open the top and manually turn the roller while the other pulls the hose. Would not recommend buying at all.
customer_reviews.author: W. M. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Magically reel in the hose
customer_reviews.text: Almost magic! One of the tasks I hate doing, is rolling up a garden hose after use. This little item takes the frustration out of doing just that. Holds 100 feet of 5/8 " hose, and retrieves it back on the reel al.ost magically. Just pull a lever, leaving the water on and the reel automatically retrieves the hose neatly wrapped around the reel. Liked it so much, bought 2 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Courtship

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME hose storage/winder
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this model of auto hose rewinder. I bought my first one at Costco 2-3 years ago, and liked it so much that I found it here at Amazon to purchase another one for my backyard. The only thing they could improve is to have a better way of attaching the drain hose, which is a total pain in the butt to assemble. Doable, but a headache and easily remedied by having a real threaded attachment. Didn't drop the rating for this though, since once that is done the daily operation of the Aquawinder is a dream. I really dislike trying to wind hoses onto standard hose bibs, and this is so easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Bake Woman

customer_reviews.title: Worked the first year, but...
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, worked great the first year, broke the first time I tried to use it this year. Moved the handle to start winding my hose back up, heard a snap, and saw a few pieces of white plastic fall to the ground. Now I have a fountain of water coming out of the side of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nall

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, bad engineering. Was able to rewind maybe 2 feet of hose before it blew it's guts out and started leaking water all over. I called the company and they sent me a new valve assy. Easy swap out but once I turned the water on again, water was still pouring out of it. Called the company again, was told I needed to send them a video of the leak before they would send me a new water motor assy. Video sent, part swapped out and installed, water turned back on and maybe 2 feet before a cracking sound and water again pouring out of the unit. I'm done!
customer_reviews.author: Terrimk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: After reluctantly buying this after being skeptical about it working and after using it more than a year now, I LOVE IT. I've run through 2-3 manually cranked hose reels in recent years. With 100 feet or more of hose it becomes a real pain to reel up and eventually the hose always gets crossed up or crimped inside the housing which makes it harder and more frustrating to use. On this the hose pulls out just as easily and totally eliminates the pain of manually rewinding. Mine has not missed a beat in 14 months of use and I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: We like this so much we now have three of these!
customer_reviews.text: I got my first one of these at Costco. Same price. Brought it home to a husband who looked at the box with a grimace of "Do you really think this will work?" Had I known what I know now, I would have played him a bit. This not only works but is nice quality! I now have three! I use 100 foot hoses and this winds them like a champ! I'd say it's winding is about foot a second. So you're not going to get sun burnt waiting for it. It comes ready to attach your hose and begin working. The wicker look is nice and raised to look quite natural.
customer_reviews.author: KR Kingston

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of them. For $100 apiece I expected something heavier with higher quality. It was a very lightweight cheap resin. The drain hose was about an eighth of an inch too small to fit over the lead. And the hose connection on the inside was too close to the spindle to easily attach the hose. I decided to return them. On the plus side the the company's customer service was outstanding. Amazon botched the return process but the company cleared it up quickly and easily. I'd give them 5 stars for that. Very impressed. For that reason I wouldn't hesitate to buy other products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: ,john devine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. The first began to malfunction during its third year and the customer service I received was excellent. No arguments, no out of warrantee decline, they just sent a replacement. And the very happy news was that during the 3 year span since my initial purchase, they had improved the design significantly. The replacement was stronger and faster than the original, and 5 years after receiving it, the winder's performance has not degraded at all..
customer_reviews.author: Wayland Myers

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I expected. I was skeptical having never owned a self winder. It works really well with lighter weight, fabric type hoses. A key to getting it to work right is to stretch the hose out in front, so it’s pulling straight. If it can pull straight, no problems, and winds nice without kinking the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The concept is brilliant, but there are glitches
customer_reviews.text: The concept is brilliant, but there are glitches! The drain hose is a little snug so what I recommend is that you take a cigarette lighter and warm up the end about one in back! Then install the hose. The other issue is the hose for the water supply. As this is my second one purchased I learned from the first installation! Go to Home Depot and spend a $ 1.25 and get a male hose to female hose adapter with a swivel and your installation will be much easier! Overall I love it, both of my units are brand new so time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Desroche

customer_reviews.title: I like the variety of other products with the same color ...
customer_reviews.text: I had my husband help me with the installation which was mildly frustrating. It seems to be working well so far though. We use a bucket to collect all the water used to reel it up which is an eye sore and somewhat defeats the purpose. Our hose was too large to utilize the stopper but it doesn't seem to be a problem as it stops reeling when it gets to the spray nozzle. I like the variety of other products with the same color and pattern. I also purchased the fence to help hide our air-conditioner.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Durability
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a little over a year ago, and realized it would be problematic right from the start. There was no way to secure the box in place, so it would not unreel without someone holding it while I pulled. Then the gearing to release/unreel the hose went kaput--it actually went bad some months ago, but I tolerated it; it just got worse till, finally, I couldn't pull the hose out at all. Had to unroll the whole 100 feet by hand. You can guess where the winder went next. Would not recommend it; will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: MAJRogerRet

customer_reviews.title: These work great and save your back
customer_reviews.text: These work great and save your back. I only wish they were a little cheaper. They need better mounting options too. I would love if they made a large base that was easier to attach to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: R. Peck

customer_reviews.title: Just bought a second one, it’s that good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this two years ago, still works great. Uses a relatively small amount of water to drive the rewind. We have a 100 ft heavy duty hose and there is just enough space. This is attractive, saves a lot of time, frustration and sore back muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Brame

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Warning, once you have the self winding version you cannot go back to the non winding one. My self winding garden hose keeper recently died and I had to replace it. This item looked stylish so I decided to try it. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and how smooth it is to pull out my hose. My old one always gave me a workout when I had to pull out the hose for more length. I would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope M

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Received this today. Spent time reading set-up directions. Set it up. Seemed to work well: it wound up hose as advertised. It worked well until I went to unwind the hose. It tuned out the the bottom controller which goes back and forth leading the hose to wind evenly over the reel, was not connected to the a bottom railing as it was supposed to be. As I unwound the hose, it would jam against the top of the exit opening. More than frustrating after all the time and effort I had spent in assembling it.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Ruddy

customer_reviews.title: Unit uses 5-6 gallons of water to rewind thru a discharge tube connected to unit
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this a simply "it's OK" rating. It may fit your needs better. I didn't realize this product used so much water to self wind, or that the discharge for the auto wind mechanism is right at the unit. Upon unpacking the discharge hose was crumpled, bent and very stiff. Even ran hot water thru it to try to get it straightened out and get the kinks out. Nope. Must be attached to the unit, so I could see that wasn't gonna work in a garage or deck situation. Last the manual it uses 5-6 gallons of water to rewind your hose. I returned it and ordered a simple crank type.
customer_reviews.author: HutchyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I love this winder!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have bought. My first one I had to leave with the house I just sold. drat! They are easy to set up, and simple to operate - and they just work! My first one last for several years, so I do not see why this one would not. The vendor got this to me in record time, and in great shape so I am a very happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: C. Richards

customer_reviews.title: This is my fourth Aquawinder, and although I think ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Aquawinder, and although I think it is superb compared to other choices in the market, I had a problem with the hose which links the Aquawinder with the spigot on the house. Although the hose was tightened sufficiently on the hose reel, the metal connection attached to the hose reel leaked. I have not experienced that in previous Aquawinder reels. I just need to have that hose replaced; I have the unit out of the box and ready to go otherwise. There is no place on the returns to just have the hose itself replaced. I no longer have the box, as I did not foresee any problems, having had none in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Novak

customer_reviews.title: Ok but the parts are cheap
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now and didn't review.. I wanted to use it for a while..well it still works but it slowed down in the wite maybe because the hose is cold and stiff ?I don't know.. but as a couple others said when I opened the top and looked in the sides of the reel were warped almost like it was melted.. it's still functioning but made out of cheap plastic.. I probably won't buy this kind again because of that..but like I said it's still working for now
customer_reviews.author: craig

customer_reviews.title: VERY convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for about five years, still working perfectly. Bought this for a friend. Works just like it should and very convenient. Be sure to drain in freezing weather to avoid breakage. Consider piping the waste water (when you use the rewind feature) onto your garden.
customer_reviews.author: K.T. Portland

customer_reviews.title: Fyi
customer_reviews.text: The hose attachment piece is a solid piece of plastic. I had to buy a swivel connector piece to attach the water source hose. Not a big deal but head's up. Also, the plastic piece that stops the hose while reeling it back on the reel is not big enough for a 5/8 inch hose.
customer_reviews.author: Paula White

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Great for a year of occasional use. If you don't mind spending 90.00 or so every year to have your hose automatically wound up while dumping water somewhere out of the back of it, buy this one. I bought one from Amazon two years ago and had to replace it with one from Costco last year and now it won't wind up again with just a 50 ft hose on it. It squeaks terribly and it seems like the plastic gears just don't have the strength to keep working.
customer_reviews.author: cc enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Hose Rewinder Malfunctions!
customer_reviews.text: This hose rewinder does not allow the hose to be released from the rewinder. My landscaper, who is a young man who has worked for me for 10 yrs, fought with it, and he struggled to get it to release the hose without success. It is very frustrating to purchase an item that does not function as advertised. This one, at least the one I purchased, malfunctions. Was this why it was on sale?My neighbor purchased this item from a different vendor and his will not rewind. Usually, Amazon vendors are excellent. Unfortunately, this vendor cannot be trusted.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy R P

customer_reviews.title: Works and then stops working
customer_reviews.text: This hose reel works great for awhile. After about a year and a half the handle on the cross over valve between reel up and reel out broke with the valve jammed. Too bad, this expensive plastic thing died and has become yard trash. I suggest the company make something longer lasting to get my next purchase attention.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Nagy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the GARDEN.
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the garden. Very easy to unroll (make sure there is no water in the hose) and a pleasure to push the lever and have it roll right up without cranking or hard work. Looks great. No leaking. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hirschhorn

customer_reviews.title: Great.. works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great.. works perfect. The rear anchors to ground could use some improvement. If this is placed near the house where the house foundation extends past the walls under the soil.. you will find that the provided anchors are somewhat useless. Overall, performs well.. love it..
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Came already assembled so I didn’t have to worry about that. Hose feeder quit moving back and forth within a month. Have to manually spread the hose over the reel as it winds back up. Do like the “automatic” rewind feature - I have the discharge hose go in the pool. No wasted water.
customer_reviews.author: CA Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It's Only OK
customer_reviews.text: It's only OK. Does not support more than 100 foot 5/8 inch hose. But the worst thing is the little auger bit that moves the hose left and right during rewind is broken. TWO UNITS.....same problem. Thy should make a better design. So, I manually move the hose left and right during rewind. Left hand helping push the hose in to the box, right hand moving the hose around the reel from left to right so it does not bunch up. If this issue dis not exist, and the rewid was a bit more powerful (and my water preeure is great) it would be a 5-star device.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Good looking unit, winds and holds 100' of high quality rubber hose like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because no one in my family takes the time to coil up the hose which means it's always left either in a pile or laid out around the deck. So I bought this. I wasn't sure if it would be strong enough to pull in 100' of high quality rubber hose, which is heavier than those crappy vinyl hoses, but it is. It will pull the entire length of hose without a pause. Now the hose is always stashed away nicely which also help prolong it's life. The wicker looks helps it not stand out like a sore thumb as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: The best hose reel ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is unbelievable how easy it is to wind up the hose!!!! I started with one and now have purchased one for each spigot at my home and my Mom's. Just flip the switch while the water is still on and it winds up automatically! All I do is help guide it a bit, because I use a 100 foot hose. I turn it off just before the end of the hose is about to go inside, because sometimes it can be difficult to get back out. I can't say enough about how great this product is!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor reviews were right, after ignoring the warnings and purchasing/using for 1 month it's already broken and trash
customer_reviews.text: Read all the other reviews, didn't believe it could be so bad of a product, disappointed all around. Ordered it about a month ago and after regular us the hose is nearly impossible to pull out of the unit. Using a 75ft hose, trying to pull it out requires my wife to hold it down and I have to pull aggressively to get it to unwind. You can hear a 'clicking' sound when unwinding it, seems like something is wrong with the gears, but in looking through the inside of the unit, nothing appears to be broken. extremely disappointed, will be contacting the MFR or returning this garbage ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Deniz

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all of these past gardening years??!
customer_reviews.text: Even though I love to garden, I hated having to rewind our 100 ft. hose, but not anymore! I just start the rewind with the flick of a handle and the water power takes care of the rest! I watch as the hose rewinds itself neatly into the container. I was so happy with this purchase and the ease-of-use, that I purchased a second one for the hose in our front yard. It's attractive too!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: difficult to unroll !!!!! design flaw!!
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult to unrolled the hose to pull it out of the container. It is great after you’re finished using the hose it automatically rewinds but the difficulty in un-rolling the hose does not offset the convenience of not having to wind it. a very bad purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Works well - a little slow and somewhat difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Works well in winding hose although maybe just a tad slow - but much better than doing it by hand! The hose included to connect to the discharge water nozzle on the winding mechanism is low quality and difficult to push onto the fitting/nozzle. It took a lot of effort even with using a little dishwashing soap to lubricate the hose/fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Enigma

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy this again
customer_reviews.text: This is well manufactured, but I am so sad I purchased it. I started to return it but it fits in the area near the house just right. But trying to pull the hose out is almost impossible with out bolting it to the house to hold it in place. Wished I had a better alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Broderick

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely write reviews but for the Suncast Aquawinder I just had to. Assembly was fairly easy. We did have a little trouble attaching the hose we bought but eventually got it on. I didnt know what to expect with the aquawinder feature but all o can say is Wow. It works perfectly and is pretty amazing.for anyone who has wrestled with normal hose reels, you have to try this product. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MomofTwins

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea of not winding the hose back that ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of not winding the hose back that is a big help and I have 3 but this item needs to be built stronger with sealed gears and the frame needs to be built stronger. If you use this items for repeated uses it will not wind and unwind like it should any dirt and yard grass will clog the winding mechanics and not work good. I took 2 apart and cleaned and greased the gears and installed screws througout the frame to make it stronger and wrk better?
customer_reviews.author: Don Collins

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for 3 years and every year I am careful to blow the water out before freezing weather and overall not abuse it. The hose reel worked well until this summer when the gears just stopped meshing correctly. I looked under the unit and the walls are just not strong enough to keep everything lined up. Since some of the gears are mounted on the inner side wall and the rest in the middle it is important to have a strong box to keep thing lined up and this box just doesn't. I've had other hose reels that use water for retraction and they lasted much longer. I'd be looking at a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: Texas Gardner
customer_reviews.text: I loved this at first but then it quit working so great. I need to try to take it apart and find out the problem. The hose isn't draining when it rolls up??? I'm a 70 year old lady and bought it because I hate rolling up a 100' hose. If I can't figure it out I'm going to try to return it. I think it has a year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Hill Country Buyer

customer_reviews.title: It rolls the hose
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th Aquawinder Hose reel I have purchased.. 2 others still in service, one died and this is for my 85 year old mother. Great product. Only issue with this one is they didn't include enough screws to attach the ball on the hose to keep it from being wound too far. Oh well, they usually break within a year anyway. But the reel is a good way yo roll your hose if you use it correctly. Always have your hose open (water flowing) as you roll it up. It keeps it flexible and rolls better.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Mic

customer_reviews.title: Easy and works great.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had one at her house, she showed me how it worked. I ordered one right there and then. It works great. To think I’ve rolled a 100 foot hose for all these years and I’m 65! This thing is amazing, it sucks the hose right up, mine is long so you have to guide it a little, but it’s easy and looks so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick wind up compactly stores my hose out of the way. Drain hose is long enough to tuck into the garden, no waste.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my super long hose compactly put away. So easy to set up and use, I placed the drain hose in the garden to water with the drain water that winds up the hose. It's about 8 gallons of water spit out in the drain hose to my garden but makes the process so easy.
customer_reviews.author: queenkimlee

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it...
customer_reviews.text: Product design is extremely poor. The unit will break within months. Mine broke in just five weeks and five uses. And I was careful with it. Brilliant technology, but Suncast doesn't seem to care so much about quality. And I will have to take a sledge hammer to get my 100' hose out of reel.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: but if you are careful it works fine. Works best with a lighter weight hose (we ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had one of these in my front yard for years. Bought this for my front yard. They work well. You do need to pay attention when reeling in the hose so it doesn't mis-wind inside, but if you are careful it works fine. Works best with a lighter weight hose (we had a heavy/strong hose that was too stiff). We did have one of these where the plastic crank inside broke and required entire unit replacement. But it lasted quite awhile so no huge complaints.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: you have to have good water pressure, and if you do, it works GREAT
customer_reviews.author: YOUHANNAS

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this after using one we bought at COSTCO over a year previously, which has given satisfactory service. I had been amazed to see that the hose return actually works - well! I would have given it 4 stars, but the older one is beginning to "chatter" as we unwind the hose, so it may be going bad. I'll update if it lasts through next year to upgrade the rating, but right now, it may be ready to quit. The one I purchased through Amazon, in late March has been working without incident (of course, we've only used it 3 or 4 times during the spring, here in Florida).
customer_reviews.author: Walt R.

customer_reviews.title: No winding~
customer_reviews.text: This is tough to review. Parts of it seems really cheaply made, others are better. If you're putting it on concrete, don't buy this one, it needs to be anchored by pinning it to the dirt. I had to tie it to a pillar. It's pretty cool to not have to wind up a 100' hose though!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Colegrove

customer_reviews.title: Only works for 1 season.
customer_reviews.text: What does it matter if it is easy to assemble if a year later you can’t pull the hose out and have to manually roll it up by reaching inside and physically moving the wheel? It only lasts 1 season. I tried to get a replacement with no answer and am left with 2 of these, one doesn’t roll out or in, and the other (which is in more shade) is starting to have problems rolling in. I feel cheated. With all that is going on in the world you would think I could water the planters in my own back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should not sell this terrible of a product
customer_reviews.text: This hose reel is a piece of junk. The hose guide disengaged the first time I used it. After I repaired it, the reel warped in 90 degree heat. My wife could not pull the hose out. I have other hose reels by Suncast and they have lasted for years. This is very cheaply made. Amazon should not sell this terrible of a product. It only worked one time. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Hose doesn’t pull out anymore
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of Suncast products and normally find them reliable but not in this case. I’ve had this hose reel for less than 11 onths and now it is nearly impossible to pull the hose out. Moreover, it will only rewind if I hold the hose and remove any tension. To say the least, very disappointed and would recommend buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: had for over a year & doesn't pull out of unit unless I reel by hand!
customer_reviews.text: So this unit was awesome for a year plus but after contacting suncast regarding my problem of not being able to pull out they said it was under warranty & sent me parts that are not working either! Spent several hours with this unit & very disgruntled with the company!
customer_reviews.author: mom mom ss

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Design, Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: First time I’ve ever felt the need to post a review on a product... Ever... I own two of these and they both have the same issue with the plastic reel warping. It’s become a tug of war to pull the hose out every time. I guess these weren’t built to withstand outdoor elements. Customer service is non-existent, and the warranty is garbage. Most good reviews are probably from people who haven’t owned them that long. When these worked, they were great. But they don’t last more than 6 months. Save yourself some aggravation and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Howard

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I bought another
customer_reviews.text: Liked it so much I bought another! What a relief not to have to hand wind a length, heavy hose. At my age, we need all the conveniences available in handling heavy yard tools. This self-winding tool is fantastic. And, if it should break from usage or age, I will be purchasing the same unit. It's convenient, attractive, and, so far, very reliable. Well worth it's cost!
customer_reviews.author: George J. Bender

customer_reviews.title: the stakes are useless because I have to pull so hard to get ...
customer_reviews.text: After 1 yr., I'm writing a different review! The hose is impossible to pull out now. Therefore, the stakes are useless because I have to pull so hard to get the hose to unwind. Rolling up requires a lot of help because the guide has broken, I guess. Otherwise, the hose winds up all on one side and overlaps the reel so then you can't even wind it up. I think good metal parts would have made this a better product.
customer_reviews.author: S.G.

customer_reviews.title: Aquawinder Hose Reel
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for another that became unusable due to an accident. With a pull of a lever the hose winds itself into the cabinet handis s free. To get the hose to move into the cabinet there must be a closed nozzle at the end of the hose to hold water pressure in the hose.The water in the hose is discharged through a small hose on one side of the hose reel cabinet into a nearby flower bed or lawn area.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Ely

customer_reviews.title: Winding gears are made out of plastic
customer_reviews.text: After buying the hose reel last August, using it for three warm months (August, September, part of October, and the last week or so), the winding gear no longer works. I sent Suncraft an email. We’ll see how they honor their three year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget, make sure to fix it or it will chase you
customer_reviews.text: Great device for the garden and deck. It would be even better if they provided instructions for how to secure it to the deck. the bars provided work great in the garden, I used deck screws to fix it to the deck on the back. By the way, having a way to secure it from the side would be a good addition since due to the design, I had to leave a gap between the winder and the wall in order to be able to set the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome. 2nd one I have gotten
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. 2nd one I have gotten. One for front yard , one for the backyard. Saves so much time. Just be gentle with the leaver.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne Lunsford

customer_reviews.title: Suncast customer service non existent and don't answer phone.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after three or four times I used it. Plastic gears seized up and wouldn't rewind. Contacted Suncast an they needed receipt, and video on what was wrong. What's wrong is it's Chinese crap. Don't waste your money. Amazon shouldn't sell this crap. Suncast has done nothing to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I should not recommend this unit to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I used this one for a few months and last month this unit was broken down(I turned on the water and it automatically rewinded the hose and I could not stop it) . I sent the unit back to Suncast service center and until now I still did get the unit back ! I have been waiting for this unit almost a month ! I should not recommend this unit to anyone ! Vu Le
customer_reviews.author: TOMMY LE

customer_reviews.title: Buy yours now
customer_reviews.text: Great price,fast delivery, easy assembly. Works great. Plastic ball that prevents over rewinding is too brittle and broke but that didn't stop me from buying 2 more. (The plastic ball on the second one broke within a week) I purchased (on Amazon, of course) a different nozzle which makes the plastic ball unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD RUDDELL

customer_reviews.title: however best if you can cement something into ground to hold ...
customer_reviews.text: Really works, however best if you can cement something into ground to hold it in place...comes with stakes, but not sturdy enough if you drag hose around...mine goes cock-eyed a little, so I have to keep straightening it since I am like OCD about such things. Otherwise, works great...I HATE having to wind hose by hand. Another thing to note, the water used to wind the hose gets expelled out the side of the unit. It comes with about a 6 foot hose so you can direct the waste water away, but still cumbersome if you dont want a puddle in your yard...best to drain to curb or flower bed that needs water, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for your yard!
customer_reviews.text: Chalk this one up to ingenuity. This has set the standard for all hose holders from here on out. Wasn’t sure how this would work but it does, using the water pressure to self-wind. Loved mine so much I purchased one for the backyard and one for my mom for a buy gift and she also loves it!
customer_reviews.author: ATLAmy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be having some problems after about a year ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be having some problems after about a year of use. Doesn't want to roll up the hose. Makes a lot of noise. Leaks water out of the pump drain when it's not in roll up mode. I should've bought a hand powered one.
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: Worthless within a year.
customer_reviews.text: This hose reel worked great for a few months, but within a year I couldn't pull the retracted hose out of the device. Even when the hose was wound on the hose reel properly & evenly, I still couldn't pull the hose out without placing my foot on the reel box and yanking on the hose will full strength. Don't bother with this item unless you only need it to work for a few months. This is the last Suncast item I ever buy. $100 down the drain!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Zrebiec

customer_reviews.title: This was a great product the 3 times it worked
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product the 3 times it worked! On the fourth use, a plastic piece broke inside and we had to send it back. Unfortunately we'll have to try another option. Great idea, but poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: KTBug47

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for reeling in a 100’ garden hose without getting your hands dirty. Flip the switch and the power of the water pressure spins an internal impeller that cranks the hose in for you. Note that water is discharged out of a separate discharge hose (included) while it is doing this. However, if you point the discharge hose toward your garden or flower bed, or collect it, it is not wasted. Discharge hose needs to be attached to a nipple. It helps to squirt a little silicone lube or disch soap on the nipple first to ease insertion.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use. I got so tired of crank ones that eventually hurt my shoulder trying to wind them up. Just flip the switch and it does it itself. The setup is a little more difficult due to the discharge hose. It is nice that you can lay it in the grass or flower bed and water that too.
customer_reviews.author: jdickerh

customer_reviews.title: Never knew how great this could be
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, if you can make your life a teensy bit easier, then why not do it. Flip a switch and the hose reels itself back in. It's fairly quick and even pulls hard enough to unstick my hose from the edge of the flagstone patio when it catches. It's great if you've got a tweaked shoulder. Didn't know I needed this until I had it. So easy to use even a small child can use it.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble with it right at the beginning. Discharge is to thin and likes to link and not let the flow of water go through.I will be changing out the hose. I wish it was on wheels so it would be easier to move.
customer_reviews.author: KIRK HANSEN

customer_reviews.title: Operating instructions and notations need to be updated in the manual.
customer_reviews.text: After testing the product, I found that you are unable to pull the hose out with the water turned on. I called the vendor to see if there was an issue with this model and the response was that you are supposed to pull the hose out with the water turned off and then go back turn the water on. Other than that, and comparing with other electronic models, this seems to be the best I've tested so far in Winding the hose backup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and sluggish
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the same item a year ago and it worked perfect. This one withing a few days of use starting making a loud noise and the reeling became very sluggish. I need to contact the manufacturer and find out what is the problem
customer_reviews.author: Alexron

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product for the Lazy or Elderly
customer_reviews.text: Great invention. Just one issue that could be improved. The outlet hose is just horrible. Get a better hose and I would rate it higher. It will waste 5 gallons of water, but I will live with that as I am getting any younger.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco A. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Have had three of these at two different houses all have been easy to use. I like this product and would buy it again. The longest I have owned this product is 5 years so they have held up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex c

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Beware. The manufacturer's 3 years warranty only provides parts when it breaks and you have to figure out how to take it apart and fix it. If you do buy it, buy it from a retailer who will always take it back when it breaks because it likely will.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Poe

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install and setup and with twice to three ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on 09/04/0/17 and as of today it's near impossible to pull the hose out. It was easy to install and setup and with twice to three times per week use. It has now started to fail. The hose will retract,at a snails pace, but it takes quite the pull to extract it. I've attempted to clean it, but still it's not working as designed. I would have expected at least a years worth of use; but it seems that it was not meant to be. The product worked as intended, but not for the long run. That's why I've given it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Mata

customer_reviews.title: Definite buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had two of these in another home and left them for the new owners. These things are great. I had the last ones for ten years before we moved and I expect these will do the same. This is a "win, win" buy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie 9

customer_reviews.title: Constructed very cheap for the price
customer_reviews.text: When you screw in your water hose, most water hoses have metal fittings. On this hose winder the fitting you screw your hose into is plastic. So if you don’t screw it exactly straight, you strip the threads. This should have a metal fitting. There is no way to fix it at this point. Money wasted here
customer_reviews.author: wizcompter

customer_reviews.title: ... do not know of a product that does a better job, but the plastic gears wear out after ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these hose winders and do not know of a product that does a better job, but the plastic gears wear out after several years. Someday maybe they will make the gears out of a stronger material like METAL! I would be willing to pay more for a hose winder that lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Magnolia Bob

customer_reviews.title: This is a well built nice working device
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built nice working device. You turn the lever and the hose starts winding up. really nice, no hand cranking. Some users complained about the water that's used/lost through the winding process but i just catch it in a bucket and pour it on some nearby plants..kinda felt guilty letting it just go into the ground even though my part of the country has no problem with water. Oh liked it so much i just ordered a second.
customer_reviews.author: doggiehowser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! The box itself is really sturdy and well constructed, and surprisingly enough the hose retraction is very fast! I have a relatively heavy duty 100' and it wraps up in under a minute. There is a spout on the side where the water shoots out of when it is coiling, but it can be corrected easily enough with a small piece of pvc, or pointing toward a garden. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: If you haven't bought one you should.
customer_reviews.text: I first saw one of these at a friend's house and was surprised at how well it worked reeling in the hose. Decided then and there I had to have one and it does everything it says it does. You pull a lever and the hose curls up inside. No more cranking!!!
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Blaske

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I've had it for 2 weeks and it works as advertised, it reels a pretty long and thick waterhose, I can see how the size and weight of my hose makes it difficult to reel with the water power and I think if it was any longer it would not be able to work as you expect. The materials seem to be of good quality and very pretty, I have other "Suncast" products and they all seem pretty well designed and built, yet again time will tell as they all are exposed to the elements. Looks good & works well, so I give it 5 stars and hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: AR123

customer_reviews.title: I really like that this gives you the best of both worlds ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this gives you the best of both worlds by keeping our hose nice and neat and reeling it in for us! We have almost 4 acres and we use this all the time. Only problem is that we have to line up the hose so it's straight and in front of the reel if we don't want to assist it. We always stand there to watch and help it along to make sure it doesn't mess up. So far it hasn't and it's nice that we don't have to wear ourselves out by reeling it up.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Rapp

customer_reviews.title: Color's not as shown in discription
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to post here, in case you're expecting a reel to coordinate with your house color. I have a medium taupe colored house (like half the others in the neighborhood) and liked the dark taupe reel shown in the description. Unfortunately, the reel is a very dark charcoal - nearly black, and would stick out like a sore thumb at the front of the house. Suncast makes a different model reel that is the right taupe color (not a wicker pattern - kind of a pretend wood crate) I'm ordering another of those, after about eight years of use from the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Keep your yard tidy the lazy way
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this winder. We bought one at Costco a year ago for the back yard and loved it so much that we bought one for the front yard too. Haven't had any trouble with the hose getting kinked or stuck. Winds itself which is awesome. Tucked away so you don't have to look at the hose. Cheaper by about 20% on Amazon vs buying it at Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  A+
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! Worked easily for us being older with back issues. Had to buy a little larger hose for outgoing water. The hose that was with the product was impossible to put on. Arrived quickly, and undamaged. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Murry

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Does all the hard part of reeling in a hose.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one, and while I'm not a fan of plastic products, this reel does a very good job of providing leak-free self-winding service. The included round "stop" that prevents the hose from going all the way into the unit broke the first week. The tab inside which grips the hose is too small for a normal size hose. We've had our first one 3-4 years and it is still working great, although it is showing signs of sun fade.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great look, sturdy but...
customer_reviews.text: Everything good but the connection from source hose to product is plastic and not metal or sturdy. Contemplating on self modifying this compromise. It leaks here if being bent the wrong way as well. You'll lose water if it goes uncheck.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Dean, RD

customer_reviews.title: My favorite garden tool!
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews first and took the advice to read directions first and it works beautifully. Even my 3 yr old can work it and loves to watch it wind the hose. I use it weekly. I love having no handle to crank, no electricity or batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY ..PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: BUYERS BEWARE! This has been an inferior product from the time it was received ..this was purchased on March 23 and the return option is only 30 days ..We had tried it less than 10 x and the hose reel gears already stripped ...We have contacted Suncast multiple times by email and by phone (45 min hold times) we sent a video showing that this hose reel Is not working ..NO RESPONSE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Suncast Aquawinder 125' Wicker Garden Hose Reel - Lightweight Portable Hands - Free Water Powered Retractable Hose Reel - Java
product_meta.description: This Suncast Java Wicker Garden Hose Reel has 125 feet of capacity. Take the hassle out of watering your garden! This hose reel uses its Smart Trak to guide the hose neatly into the reel. This means no dealing with tangle ups that are not only difficult to straighten out, but take away your time. To make things even easier, the hose reel can be reeled in by simply pressing a lever and it automatically reels in itself. Its compact size is ideal to fit your outdoor space. Its stunning structural design looks great with any patio, deck, and other outdoor decor. This retractable hose reel can do it all and is a gardener's best friend.
feature_bullets: AUTOMATIC HOSE REEL: Water-powered wicker garden hose reel uses Smart Trak to guide hose neatly into reel
HANDS FREE: To rewind the hose, simply press a lever and it automatically reels in!
DURABLE: The hose reel is made of durable plastic casing with a wood-like texture to match your outdoor decor
GENEROUS CAPACITY: Hose reel has a 125' of 5/8 hose capacity- perfect for domestic or industrial use
IDEAL SIZE: The hose reel measures 24" x 27" x 23.5", perfect for your outdoor space
Hands free rewinding at a flip of a lever
Leader hose and discharge tube included
Attractive design fully conceals hose and reel

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,294 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
